headline.main: AP Report on Slave-Peeled Shrimp Spurs Calls for Boycott
headline.print_headline: AP Report on Slave-Peeled Shrimp Spurs Calls for Boycott

docs.snippet: U.S. officials and human rights activists called on Americans to stop buying fish and shrimp tied to supply chains in Thailand, where The Associated Press has found slaves are forced to work in the seafood industry....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. officials and human rights activists called on Americans to stop buying fish and shrimp tied to supply chains in Thailand, where The Associated Press has found slaves are forced to work in the seafood industry.

headline.main: Boeing Boosts Share Buyback to $14 Billion, Hikes Dividend
headline.print_headline: Boeing Boosts Share Buyback to $14 Billion, Hikes Dividend

docs.snippet: Boeing Co raised its share repurchase authorization to $14 billion from $12 billion and also increased its quarterly dividend, a sign of confidence in its cash outlook despite plans to cut production....
docs.lead_paragraph: Boeing Co raised its share repurchase authorization to $14 billion from $12 billion and also increased its quarterly dividend, a sign of confidence in its cash outlook despite plans to cut production.

headline.main: Trump at Center Stage, but Cruz in Spotlight at GOP Debate

headline.main: Yemen Ceasefire to Begin Tuesday as U.N. Talks Open, Saudi Coalition Says
headline.print_headline: Yemen Ceasefire to Begin Tuesday as U.N. Talks Open, Saudi Coalition Says

docs.snippet: A ceasefire to halt nine months of war in Yemen will take hold at noon local time (0900 GMT) on Tuesday, coinciding with the start of U.N.-backed peace talks in Switzerland, the Saudi-led coalition said on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A ceasefire to halt nine months of war in Yemen will take hold at noon local time (0900 GMT) on Tuesday, coinciding with the start of U.N.-backed peace talks in Switzerland, the Saudi-led coalition said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Airlines’ On-Time Results Among the Best in 2 Decades
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Leading Airlines Post Gains in Punctuality Results

docs.snippet: The nation’s leading airlines posted one of their best-ever monthly on-time performances in October....
docs.abstract: Transportation Department says 87 percent of flights on top 13 United States airlines arrived on time in October, up from 86.5 percent in September.
docs.lead_paragraph: The nation’s leading airlines posted one of their best-ever monthly on-time performances in October.

headline.main: Man Pleads Guilty to Assault on Flight From Seattle to Maui
headline.print_headline: Man Pleads Guilty to Assault on Flight From Seattle to Maui

docs.snippet: A college student in a Honolulu courtroom Monday used a soft voice to recount his drunken behavior on a flight from Seattle to Maui, which included hitting a flight attendant....
docs.lead_paragraph: A college student in a Honolulu courtroom Monday used a soft voice to recount his drunken behavior on a flight from Seattle to Maui, which included hitting a flight attendant.

headline.main: Maryland Man Accused of Trying to Support Islamic Militants
headline.print_headline: Maryland Man Accused of Trying to Support Islamic Militants

docs.snippet: A Maryland man is in federal custody after being charged with trying to provide support to militants in the Islamic State group and receiving money allegedly intended for carrying out a terrorist attack on U.S. soil, authorities said Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Maryland man is in federal custody after being charged with trying to provide support to militants in the Islamic State group and receiving money allegedly intended for carrying out a terrorist attack on U.S. soil, authorities said Monday.

headline.main: Rabbi Sentenced for Role in Religious Divorce Coercion Ring
headline.print_headline: Rabbi Sentenced for Role in Religious Divorce Coercion Ring

docs.snippet: An Orthodox rabbi was sentenced Monday to more than three years in prison for his role in a ring of Jewish men who used brutal methods and tools, including handcuffs and electric cattle prods, to torture unwilling husbands into granting their wive...
docs.lead_paragraph: An Orthodox rabbi was sentenced Monday to more than three years in prison for his role in a ring of Jewish men who used brutal methods and tools, including handcuffs and electric cattle prods, to torture unwilling husbands into granting their wives religious divorces.
